Recyclability.Reason: PET is a widely recyclable plastic material, and it can be converted into various products such as packaging materials, textiles, and more.

Potential Products.Description: Recycled PET can be used to manufacture new packaging materials, reducing the need for virgin plastic and decreasing waste.
PET fibers can be spun into yarns and used to produce clothing, upholstery, and other textile products.
Recycled PET can be used to manufacture carpeting and rugs, providing a sustainable alternative to traditional materials.
PET can be converted into synthetic fibers used in the production of ropes, twines, and other industrial applications.

Waste.Label: Banana Peels
Waste.Composition: Organic waste (mainly cellulose, lignin, and starch)

Derivable Products.Description: Banana peels can be added to compost piles to create nutrient-rich soil for gardening and agriculture.
Banana peels can be used as a nutritious feed supplement for animals, such as chickens and pigs.
Banana peels can be converted into bioethanol or biodiesel, providing a renewable energy source.
Banana peels can be used to create a natural dye for textiles and other materials.

Useful Products.Description: Aluminum cans can be recycled and reused to produce new aluminum products, reducing the need for primary aluminum production.
Aluminum foil can be recycled and used to produce new aluminum products, such as cookware, packaging materials, and even new aluminum cans.
Aluminum waste can also be recycled and used to produce other aluminum products, such as window frames, door handles, and even aircraft parts.

derived_products.description: Can be reused for packaging and storage
Can be used in insulation, textiles, and construction materials
Can be used in construction, water filtration, and cosmetics
Can be used as a raw material for producing new glass products

products.name: Pulp
products.description: Cellulose fibers can be converted into pulp, which can be used to produce paper products such as packaging materials, cardboard, and tissue paper.

products.name: Biomass
products.description: Cellulose fibers can be converted into biomass, which can be used as a renewable energy source or as a feedstock for the production of biofuels.

products.name: Cellulose Nanofibers
products.description: Cellulose fibers can be processed into nanofibers, which have applications in various industries such as textiles, pharmaceuticals, and biotechnology.

Derivable Products.Description: Iron oxide can be used as a pigment in paint, coatings, and plastics.
Iron oxide can be used to produce magnetic materials, such as ferrite magnets.
Iron oxide can be used as a catalyst in various industrial processes, such as the production of polyethylene and polypropylene.
Iron oxide can be used to remove impurities and contaminants from water, such as heavy metals and other pollutants.

useful_products.description: Polystyrene can be used as a filling material in park benches, providing insulation and reducing the weight of the bench.
Polystyrene can be used to create artificial reefs, providing a habitat for marine life and helping to restore damaged ecosystems.
Polystyrene can be broken down into smaller pieces and used as a compost material, helping to improve soil structure and fertility.
